website_summaries.verdict: A must-have for toddlers, as parents can pull them along or allow them to experience sled riding for the first time down small slopes – but deep, thick snow will challenge it.
pros: Parents who want to introduce their toddlers to sledding will find this a great choice, thanks to the unique design that's suitable for kids ages 18 months to 4 years
Has a safety strap and handy tow rope
cons: Tends to be somewhat "tippy" in deep snow, which also tends to collect under it when being pulled

customer_reviews.title: Sorry to be a bad guy but I do not understand how this sled ...
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to be a bad guy but I do not understand how this sled can get any good reviews. yes the seat is very comfortable and color looks beautiful but I used it only once and donated to charity. This sled doesn't have a flat base bottom, instead it has a cut out space and snow stuck underneath and you can't pull with baby on top and so much snow stuck on the bottom. Eventually baby falls to the side. It can be god only on icy flat snow
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was a hit with my granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: The sled works great, I'm pretty sure we were pulling 3 G turns on the corners in this thing! There is nothing not to like about the sled, the rope was plenty long enough, the "seat belt" worked great to hold her in place, and it seems very durable. We are going to try it out on the ski jump hill next so I will update then ;).
customer_reviews.author: Nathan A

customer_reviews.title: Not for snow
customer_reviews.text: I’m really surprised at the ratings, which is one of the reasons I bought this sled for my 2 yr old. The design has a major flaw, it packs snow up under the front and basically doesn’t go anywhere. We can’t even pull it on flat ground for more than 10 feet without it snow packing. Maybe it would work well on ice, but not snow :/
customer_reviews.author: just joe

customer_reviews.title: The seat is a great size for my toddler
customer_reviews.text: The seat is a great size for my toddler. It's seems very comfortable and nice that there is a strap to be able to secure the child into the seat. The part I don't like is that if it is a soft snow, the snow collects under the sled as I pull it around. It's very hard to pull. We have not tried it on a hill, I have just been pulling it behind me so maybe it works better on hills.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Good for a season
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a Christmas present for my 18 month old son. The sled was a little small and flimsy for my 99th percentile kid, but he really enjoyed it. It was a great starter sled, but we won't be able to get any more use out of it. He has already outgrown it. We will hold onto it in case we decide to have more kids later, but he could have used a bigger sled and grown into it.
customer_reviews.author: CatherineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality sled
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the sled is great. We finally got to use it two years after buying it, we don't get much snow here in North Carolina ;-) My 4 year old grandson is small, 25 lbs, about 33" tall and he fit great wearing a puffy snowsuit. I wish it had a different belt system, a harness instead of just the waist belt would make this perfect. We ran around on grass that had a light snow covering and it was easy to pull. It was great fun.
customer_reviews.author: AnnMarie

customer_reviews.title: not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: the red sled photo for this item is not what we received. i uploaded a photo of what we actually got. ours is shaped completely different and doesn't have the flat part under the seat so our daughter tips over easily when we pull her. disappointed. she still had fun, and it still works, but i just wish it was the one pictured because that's why i chose to buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: l337jacqui

customer_reviews.title: This is great! Perfect for my big three month old baby ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great! Perfect for my big three month old baby (18 1/2 pounds and 26" long). he can sit up and I can pull him around and my six year old can pull him too. Very stable. It is not really big enough for the two of them together. My six year old tried very hard but it is a bit small. I can pull his sled behind the new one and get them both coasting at the same time for a walk around the block. I am glad I got it. I think we'll use it a lot this winter.
customer_reviews.author: S. Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended. Collects snow underneath & boys down the sled/gets very heavy
customer_reviews.text: I don’t recommend this sled. I love the concept - it supports our little one and has a buckle to keep them secure and seems sturdy. But beware, if you are pulling thru any snow that’s not yet compacted, due to the design it actually collects the loose snow underneath and gets extremely heavy to pull, you have to actually lift up the sled to get the snow out - super annoying
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time two weeks ago for our first snow of the season. My daughter LOVES it! I found it really easy to pull her around and she thought it was so fun to be in (she’s almost 3). I think this kind of sled is safer for little kids, and we were able to have fun in the snow just on the unplowed sidewalks and our patio— no hills required!
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect First Sled
customer_reviews.text: This is my son’s first sled and he loves it! He is 8 months old and just started sitting up on his own. I pull him on flat, snowy, surfaces outside. I also have a blanket underneath and around him in case he gets cold and it gives more cushioning, even though he is wearing his snowsuit. I highly recommend this product! Well balanced
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my toddler who won't fall backwards when pulled. No snow right now, but he loves being pulled around on the carpet. The buckle is pretty cheap and looks easily breakable, so don't depend on it too much for safety. The rope is definitely long enough for me to pull my child around, other reviews said it was too short, definitely disagree.
customer_reviews.author: Leann M Lewis

customer_reviews.title: this is a nice little sled for the most part
customer_reviews.text: this is a nice little sled for the most part. The seat straps just loop around so they can fall out the slots when not in use. I've had some trouble with the string coming out because the knots can slip through and you really can't double knot them to make it a big knot. I'm considering replaceing the string altogether. It's thin and cuts your hands. Which isn't too much of a problem when you're wearing gloves but barehanded is not advised. It otherwise glides nicely, is a pretty red color and seems to be made of very durable plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Miss

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a toddler and he loves to be pulled around in this sled. It even has a strap so that he can be strapped in without falling out. I often pull him around out yard and it moves with ease and he sits strapped in and just laughs! Definitely a must have for small children who want to play with the big kids but aren’t quite ready for a regular size sled.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Convenient Sledd For Little Ones
customer_reviews.text: This sledd had been really convenient since we got it, we've had it for over 2 years now so the picture is old, but we use it for snowshoeing and dragging our two year old behind us when he gets worn out snowshoeing only thing I would say about it that's inconvenient is the length of the rope if you're tall it's way too short if you're short perfect but it's way too short for my 6'1 husband and perfect for my 5'1 frame.
customer_reviews.author: LTM

customer_reviews.title: Small, but will serve the purpose
customer_reviews.text: So far we haven't' had snow (bummer). My concern with this is the material it is made of. It seems like it would crack easily when it was very cold and dropped ? I haven't been able to "test" it so I can't say that will happen. It is just a "concern" I had when I got it. I think if the front had a "lip" to it, it would help keep any snow from blowing up in the Toddler's face. Once again, remember I haven't been able to use it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Small and fragile
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used it a few times for our 2 year old. It is a little small for her but she doesn’t complain. We’re in Anchorage and the sidewalks are covered in ice. On the third trip the runners cracked on both sides (she is only 27 pounds so I don’t think it is a weight issue). It still pulls but collects snow along the edges now. We’re looking for a slightly larger alternative.
customer_reviews.author: SomethingElse

customer_reviews.title: My nephew loves this!
customer_reviews.text: This was beautiful and so much fun! I purchased it for my nephew for A late Christmas gift. He loved it but when my sister sent me a pic of her son in it I was so disopoonted to see his legs hung so far over the edge it was sad to see at only a little more than 1 years old it was too small.
customer_reviews.author: sjm357

customer_reviews.title: design is lacking
customer_reviews.text: works ok. the bottom has a lot of grooves so it creates a lot of drag. not as easy to pull a 25 lb kid as it could be. little insulation from the snow so my daughter gets cold more easily sitting on it. but she loves riding in it.
customer_reviews.author: J Davis

customer_reviews.title: Safe and sturdy, arrived earlier than promised
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect gift for my 8 month-old grandson. He's 100th percentile in height and 40th in weight and fits into it well. It looks like he will even get a second winter season out of it. The item arrived earlier than promised.
customer_reviews.author: MAP

customer_reviews.title: got a chance to use it over the weekend. ...
customer_reviews.text: got a chance to use it over the weekend. the bottom is not flat so when you're pulling the kiddo on the sled it just scoops up snow under it and causes it to tilt backwards. After the snow got packed down a bit was about to do some sledding. Product came as pictured (some reports were that it didn't, mine was good)
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Okay for pulling, useless for sledding
customer_reviews.text: This led is okay for city pulling/walks on the sidewalk maybe in very shallow snow; however, the underneath of the sled is hollow around the seat base so if you try move in any more than a couple of inches of snow or you want it for sledding you're out of luck. The snow will pile up inside the hollow part underneath the sled and it won't go anywhere. Otherwise, the sled is well-made, though I wouldn't classify it as a Toddler "Boggan"
customer_reviews.author: KTV

customer_reviews.title: Smaller then expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my toddler as last year we had trouble pushing the stroller in the snow. Figured it would be nice to have when I have to walk. This is super small might fit a kid up to a year maybe depends on how tall they are. Other than being super small looks like a pretty good just won't work for what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought 2 sleds, 1 for my 1 year ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 sleds, 1 for my 1 year old grand daughter and 1 as a gift for a friends daughter. They are so small, my grand daughters feet and legs hang off the front of the sled dragging in the snow. My friend claimed the same. I am returning both.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Longi

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my 8 month old. He loves riding around in it. The rope could be a little longer but that's an easy fix to do. I put a towel down for him in the seat to make it a little warmer for him. It will easily last him through this winter though I think it will be too small for him next winter.
customer_reviews.author: vera

customer_reviews.title: terrible design
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson for Christmas.terrible design!!!it has a,waist strap,which for an infant/toddler sled,is not enuf to hold him in.and he is 20months,feet were dragging on ground.the back of the sled always tilts backwards,and the handle is a simple string,very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: candy

customer_reviews.title: Snow Fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter for Xmas and it was perfect. It was one solid piece and well balanced for a small child up to 40lbs. The price was right too.
customer_reviews.author: Midge

customer_reviews.title: No winter to use this for, but pretty fun nevertheless
customer_reviews.text: Our winter didn’t produce enough snow to utilize this sled, but the sled is study, it’s supportive, and we put the sled in a wheeled scooter, and pulled her around the house and she loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna Ray

customer_reviews.title: Biggest surprise hit at xmas
customer_reviews.text: We got this because it was on sale and ended up being the biggest hit at a surprise white Xmas! Great for our 7 month old and almost 3 year old!
customer_reviews.author: hsr254

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 4 month baby girl when we got our Christmas tree!
customer_reviews.author: Kjirsten Berg

customer_reviews.title: Land Sled
customer_reviews.text: For a sled under $20 this is a great deal. Still hasn't snowed here but it rips ass though piles of leaves.
customer_reviews.author: RPPerry3

customer_reviews.title: 6 month old granddaughter loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my 6 month old granddaughter for Christmas. It's PERFECT! She hasnt mastered sitting up alone yet, so this sled was exactly what we needed. She didnt want to get out of it!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Grafing

customer_reviews.title: Only for light snow
customer_reviews.text: If the snow is heavy wet, it's difficult to pull this. Rope needs to be longer. Needs another strap between the legs. My baby kept sliding down
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Great "Toddler" sled !
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sled for our two year old. My daughter is smaller for her age, about 30 inches tall and 20 lbs. Her feet fit inside it with a little room to spare, allowing her to bend at the knees and brace herself with her legs. It might not be the best for kids much bigger because they couldn't brace themselves with their feet if they had them straight out in front of them. The straps in the seat are plenty big for getting her secured in the seat while wearing a snow suit. We have a blast with this thing. Perfect for our small toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 15m old grandson who lives in Colorado and they love it!
customer_reviews.author: Myra Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Good pull sled
customer_reviews.text: Good pull sled. The bottom isn't actually flat like I thought it would be, but haven't tested it in all snow conditions yet so I don't know well it will glide in heach snow. My daughter loves sitting in it, she likes going downhill as well. Seems balanced, I don't worry that it'll tip over. It has an adjustable seat belt.
customer_reviews.author: Verna

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our son loves this sled! It was his favorite birthday gift this year by far. It has held up well so far. The only downside is we haven’t had enough snow consistently to use it more than 2-3 times.
customer_reviews.author: Emma McClintock

customer_reviews.title: Cracked :(
customer_reviews.text: We haven't gotten a chance to use it on snow yet, but it already has a crack on the flat back bit. Yes, we have been pulling it around on carpeted surfaces inside, so I'm not sure if the crack happened before or after we received it. I'm very disappointed nonetheless... The sled itself seems comfy. I plan on editing this review once we get to use it outside.
customer_reviews.author: CreativePeach

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun in the snow
customer_reviews.text: We love this! When I hear my daughter say whee for the first time it’s got to be fun!
customer_reviews.author: Danyell

customer_reviews.title: she absolutely loved it! the string was a little short so ...
customer_reviews.text: my daughter is 1, we bought this for her this year so she could play in the snow, she absolutely loved it! the string was a little short so i made my own out of paracord, im also well over 6ft so anything to me is short
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great sled
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Bought it for my 2 year old and he loves it. I don’t know how long he will be able to use it, but right now it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: The perfect toddler sled
customer_reviews.text: Yes. The perfect toddler sled. Very glad we had this when we took our 1 year old up to the mountain for Christmas. She enjoyed being pulled around in it, and unlike a regular sled she was able to sit up and not fall out (she has great balance, but bumpy slippery snow is just too much). Keeping it clean and dry for next year, and future toddlers after that.
customer_reviews.author: Kaycee M.

customer_reviews.title: Just dont
customer_reviews.text: Got a used broken one sent to me no label and had a whole in it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs Packed Icy Snow
customer_reviews.text: Not for all types of snow. We have another sled that is much better than this one. The design results in snow piling in the front, preventing it from actually going anywhere. It may work on really packed icy snow though.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Crosier

customer_reviews.title: Very stable!
customer_reviews.text: This sled was so cute and worked very well. The snow was deep so I worried about it tipping, but it was very stable! My 7 month old granddaughter loved her ride! I think that the sled will not fit her beyond a year or so, as her feet were already close to the front. She is an average size baby.
customer_reviews.author: Marla B

customer_reviews.title: Very fun
customer_reviews.text: My son is six months and he loves this sled
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: perfect for dragging little non-walkers
customer_reviews.text: amazing that in the northeast in the middle of winter, the stores are all SOLD OUT of sleds?!! how does that even happen? needed a sled in January and could not find a single one locally. bought this for my 18 month old son while we took the bigger kids to their ski lessons. worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Smith

customer_reviews.title: Like it but no padded seat
customer_reviews.text: The item I received is just red plastic. No padded foam seat. Overall, it's a very simple design - molded plastic with a simple "seat belt" threaded through 2 slits in the back. My son loves this. We haven't had much snow yet, so I pull him around the carpet in the house. He loves it. He's in the waddler stage, and he likes to stand up and push this. The back is the perfect height for him. As other reviewers have said, the rope is pretty short for an adult to stand up and pull the sled along.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done not for more then 1 winter though!
customer_reviews.text: This I got for my daughter who is now 1. She had a great winter being pulled all around in this sled. It did seem like the buckle was always falling off and we would be serving for it. Also during the last snow fall the rope broke. However I was able to tie it up to use for another pull around. I paid under 15$ for it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L

customer_reviews.title: Great sled!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The sled is just wonderful and I bought it for my niece when she was just a little over 1 years old and it was great! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Your little one will love it!
customer_reviews.text: Super stable! Perfect for your little one. We have used this sled several times this winter & my little one loves it. It's very stable & wide enough for your little one to have multi layers & even a blanket if needed. We have used the sled on a little hill as well as just pulling it around the yard.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, she never tipped over or out. Love this for a 1 yr old!!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Green

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 and under
customer_reviews.text: Good for 1-2 years old or under. My three year old still fits, but barely. She is skinny too.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon L

customer_reviews.title: Baby sled
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my one year old granddaughter. She has had a great time in it. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TrishW

customer_reviews.title: Not for snow
customer_reviews.text: If using in actual snow this thing is pretty much useless. Slides ok on packed or groomed, would by fine on ice too but with real snow, even the 2” on my asphalt driveway, it just packs up underneath until it tips your kiddo out on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Cute little sled
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great for babies! We pulled our 7 month around in it during our first snow.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey D.

customer_reviews.title: Used product with marks in the plastic
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be a gift. I ordered a new product and it showed up used.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Cheap strap, broke immediately.
customer_reviews.text: The strap's clasp to hold the child in the sled broke after one use. It is easy to pull, but is for children who are under two years old as it is very small. My granddaughter did enjoy her first ride at 12 months old.
customer_reviews.author: History teacher

customer_reviews.title: Winter fun included
customer_reviews.text: Simple yet perfect for littles. We found this was resistant to tipping and very inviting to our little. We used it all winter and it's still like new.
customer_reviews.author: AFB

customer_reviews.title: Adorable! But buckle poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Loved this for my 11 month olds first time in the snow. Main complaint is the buckle comes off when u pull and try to adjust it. Poorly made. Otherwise adorable
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars, great, sturdy and perfect for Michigan
customer_reviews.text: So much fun for my 6 month old. THis would work great for a smaller baby or a small toddler. The value is wonderful too and it is actually quite sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Midwestmomofone

customer_reviews.title: Product durable appropriate for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Product everything it said it would be. Unfortunately NO snow for the grandchild to use it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Given as gifts for grandchildren. The parents loved how easy it was to pull.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Jane Lang

customer_reviews.title: My three year old loved it at government camp Mt
customer_reviews.text: My three year old loved it at government camp Mt.hood love that it has a set belt the only reason that I did not give if five stars is because it needs to be flat at the bottom so snow doesn't get stuck yes it will go faster but that is what a helmet is for.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Good sled
customer_reviews.text: A little smaller than expected but still good. My tall 18 month old has his feet right up to the edge. Buckles are ok. String to pull is nice and long and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Vera R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for toddler
customer_reviews.text: Our almost-2-year-old toddler loved being dragged about the yard in the snow on this little sled. The shape of the seat has good back and lateral support.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Ciaburri Studio

customer_reviews.title: Great sled for the young kiddos
customer_reviews.text: Great sled for the young kiddos, but the pull string is way to short. Forcing you to pull up on the sled when pulling it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Love this sled
customer_reviews.text: Love this sled. Works great and my daughter really enjoys being in it. Started using it when she was 8 months old
customer_reviews.author: Emily Bickford

customer_reviews.title: Great sled
customer_reviews.text: So fun! Definitely for a young child. My 18 month old is almost too big. It is full to pull them around in the snow!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: great toddler sled, especially with no hills
customer_reviews.text: Playing outside when it snows it great fun but making snow angels and building with snow only lasts so long. This is great for pulling around your toddler and getting some exercise for yourself. My husband is 5'9" and it's plenty long for him so I'd imagine anyone taller, it would have enough slack in the line to comfortably pull. It's well made and the seat has a little extra cushion. I'd imagine I'll be able to use this for many more kids to come.
customer_reviews.author: Garvin

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: Found this at Target for $15 regular price! Quite disappointed to see that since I puchased 2 through Amazon at $30 each. Had to replace 1 because it broke in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Stevens

customer_reviews.title: It's nice that it has a buckle
customer_reviews.text: We got this to pull our 9-11mo baby in the snow. It's nice that it has a buckle, but generally it's a little cheap feeling. Good for the price and minimal use!
customer_reviews.author: LauraW

customer_reviews.title: so fun!
customer_reviews.text: we bought this for our 7 month old's first trip in the snow and had a great time pulling him around in it and sending him down (small) hills. he was very securely strapped in and loved it!
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: Broken buckle
customer_reviews.text: It’s so cute and I was so excited but when I tried it out upon arrival I noticed the buckle doesn’t actually click together. It fits in, but doesn’t snap, so as soon as I started pulling my baby around (just on the carpet for practice!!!) she quickly and easily pushed it open with her belly and could have fallen out. I’m so bummed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: this sled works great. It's been fun to have this winter
customer_reviews.text: Very cute little sled! Our 11 month old loves it! I read a review that says the sled doesn't glide on top of the snow very well. That may be true, but living in Illinois, we don't get tons of snow at a time. For the few inches we have here, this sled works great. It's been fun to have this winter.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 13 month daughter LOVES this sled, and so do I. She is on the smaller side, but will still use it next year. It's so stable, never tipped over. I run, like really run fast, all through the yard and this sled has been great. We are really happy with it and people keep asking us where we bought it. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Haws

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful product. You have to have a groomed area ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product. You have to have a groomed area for the sled to really slide, but other wise its awesome
customer_reviews.author: Annette M Mongar

customer_reviews.title: Great little sled
customer_reviews.text: Really great sled. Glides over snow, very easy to pull toddlers around in. Very well made and will outlast my little guy.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: great for 1-2 year old. Maybe up to 3 if your kid is not very big
customer_reviews.text: great support for the kid sitting straight. He feels safe. At 2.5 years it was a bit tight, no much leg room.
customer_reviews.author: New York Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very good and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Very good and comfy. My baby love it. We will be using them for a few years I hope. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: viktoriya biletska

customer_reviews.title: For the price it's great! Now if only it could self propel so ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's great! Now if only it could self propel so I don't have to drag my toddler all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Sbourque

customer_reviews.title: Padded Seat?
customer_reviews.text: When the item arrived, it did not have a padded seat as described. Also, I think the cord intended to pull the boggon is far too short. However, since I gave this item as a gift, I can't comment on actual usage. Finally, the item is shipped in an Amazon shipping box, with no additional packaging. I had to turn the boggon into a "gift boggon" filling it with other gifts and wrapping it like a gift basket.
customer_reviews.author: I'veGotNothing.Yet

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Only meant for baby’s too small for toddlers and not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Prettyman

customer_reviews.title: Came in and was bigger then expected but looks awesome can't wait to use it in a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: Came in and was bigger then expected but looks awesome can't wait to use it in a couple weeks.. I'll update once we use it.
customer_reviews.author: Boisvert Family

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this. We used this when he ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this. We used this when he was only 11 months old and it holds him well.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Buckle does not work
customer_reviews.text: This buckle does not work, or it would have a 5 star. Too big to return for me so I'm going to figure something out. Otherwise perfect, sturdy and wont tip over with a baby in it.
customer_reviews.author: Julie M Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best wire, it popped out just when I was ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the best wire, it popped out just when I was pulling my ~23lbs son on it for 1 minute. The rest seems fine
customer_reviews.author: Dana SR

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little sled, especially for the price!! Well worth it!! Good quality plastic, seems well made
customer_reviews.author: krissy

customer_reviews.title: Good sled for toddler
customer_reviews.text: Great little sled for a toddler to pull around on flat snow packed surface.
customer_reviews.author: ffsodak

customer_reviews.title: Hard to pull
customer_reviews.text: This is great in theory, but it really should have been manufactured with a flat surface. Snow builds up under the bottom of the sled, making it very hard to pull through the snow. I had to strap this to a real sled to make it usable.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Dean

customer_reviews.title: More Like a Baby Size Sled
customer_reviews.text: Barely fits 35 inch long 2 year old (legs come all the way up to where the little hole is). I would have gotten a different one had I known that. I was expecting the bottom to be a smooth piece of plastic, but it isn't so if the snow is wet it's not as easy to pull.
customer_reviews.author: Waterspin

customer_reviews.title: Decent slide for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for our 2 year old. There were no other sleds available for toddlers so we chose this one, due to lack of options. It's a decent sled, but lacks any type of wow factor. The pull string was too short (probably done for liability purposes). It worked just fine though and our 2 yr old enjoyed pulling it around as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mom-Um

customer_reviews.title: And it would be nice if it had a grip on the rope that ...
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this sled. It is hard to turn sometimes without having to worry about tipping it over. And it would be nice if it had a grip on the rope that pulls it because if you are not wearing gloves, it does end up hurting your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Karissa

customer_reviews.title: Stable
customer_reviews.text: Great for our 1 and 1/2 to 2 year old grandson last season. Our driveway is slightly sloped and it was fun to let him go and watch him slide without fear of tipping over. He outgrew it quickly, though, and we had to invest in a larger sled this year! The pull rope is rather short, but easily replaced with a longer rope.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna S

customer_reviews.title: ... that you pull the sled with could have been better thought out
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be well made however the rope that you pull the sled with could have been better thought out. The knot slipped through the hole in the sled, I slipped it back through and added another knot. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: JSF

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 2, but one was different
customer_reviews.text: One sled arrived as pictured. The other came at a later date(back ordered ?). I didn't open the box immediately (it was for a birthday present). I assumed it was the same sled as it was in the same type box etc. When it came time to wrap the birthday present, here it was a different sled, similar but with flanges on each side and not quite the room to sit. I was disappointed. :(
customer_reviews.author: D. Grossman

customer_reviews.title: Cute sled
customer_reviews.text: This sled was a Christmas gift to my nephew. As we had a very brown holiday I did not get a chance to see him in action, but it worked well enough to "sled" around the house. It seems well made and durable, and perfect sized for a two year old (he can probably still use it for another couple of years). Great gift at a good price!
customer_reviews.author: Coff33G!rl

customer_reviews.title: Works great for us
customer_reviews.text: Works great for us, but we don’t get too much snow. It’s thin plastic & the strap can fall out/ isn’t permanently connected to the sled.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not a good value at all!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed at the quality and price. I found the same exact sled at Walmart for $12.00. I paid $35.00 for the sled on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl LeMay

customer_reviews.title: There's no barrier between the sled and ground , it kind of a rough ride.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a good product, but my niece didn't like, maybe she felt too many of the bumps in the snow. She wasn't comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Flexible Flyer Baby Pull Sled. Toddler Boggan. Sleigh for Kids
feature_bullets: BABY SLED – This Flexible Flyer baby pull sled is the perfect way to tow babies on packed snow, groomed paths, or snow up to 4 inches deep
SECURE SUPPORT - Extra high back on this baby sleigh provides support for young children. Adjustable safety strap built-in to baby boggan seat to keeps your child secure
STABLE - Wide base keeps this toddler sled stable for a safe ride. Sled measures 26. 5 x 20. 5 x 10. 5
CRACK RESISTANT - High density polyethylene makes this snow sled resistant to cold weather cracking
MADE IN USA - Long tow rope for parents’ comfort. Small sled for babies and toddlers under 3 years of age. A winter sled for kids up to 40 lbs.
